sentence.text: But the patient was okay , it was a false alarm , please thank them and send them on their way .
This was not the first false alarm designed to draw the police into an ambush , although no one had been ambushed so far .
It had been a mistake the other day , a false alarm , and incalculable harm might be done if it were again too cold .
It was a false dawn , replaced soon after by a now starless night that was blacker than the previous hours .
` If this is a false dawn , it is the longest so far , " he said .
But is it a false dawn .
He was n't trying to give her false hope but was simply telling her the truth .
No , that was a false hope .
Early life on Earth may have had many false starts -- as many as ten -- with each based on a different biochemistry .
There is nothing new about a false smile , a slap on the back , the friendly use of a Christian name or artificial flattery .
Pretty silly of me to give you a false name , but I have n't much experience of -- of -- `

The sufferer is con-fronted with truth -- as seen by the peer group of patients -- rather than the version of it that corresponds to a false picture that only he or she perceives and finds acceptable .
He 'd taken out his false teeth . )
Many false trees will be generated from such a grammar , especially given the syntactic ambiguity of many English words .
They marched with their banners high and bravely fluttering , Mother Verity thinking something must be done to convert a man whose laughter was false and whose smile hid a bitter soul .
After a few false starts a whole vocabulary and syntax that he never knew he knew begins to well up from his old-fashioned black portable .
But the first thing that he says is really at the heart of his answer to the differing points of view about false ` gods " .
